de.esoco.ewt.style

Class StyleData

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.property.AbstractStringProperties
      • de.esoco.ewt.style.StyleData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.esoco.lib.property.HasProperties, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlignedPosition

    public class StyleData
extends de.esoco.lib.property.AbstractStringProperties
    This class contains style data that controls the display of a component. It consists of several appearance attributes and visual constraints. Which of these attributes are actually applied depends on the respective component and the layout of it's parent container.

    Instances of this class are immutable so that it is possible to create constants from it and to re-use StyleData objects. There are also several copy methods that return a new instance which has certain fields modified (e.g. the methods merge(StyleData), setFlags(StyleFlag...))). The possible flags in a style data object are defined as constants in the class StyleFlag.

    The style data constant DEFAULT should be used in all cases where no specific style is needed. This constant is also used internally by GEWT and in cases where a NULL value is set as the style data.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Style name: The dependent HTML style of a component (will be appended to the main style of a component to create an additional derived style name)

      Style name: The HTML style of a component

      • append

        public StyleData append(de.esoco.lib.property.PropertyName<java.lang.String> rName,
                        java.lang.String sValue,
                        java.lang.String sSeparator)
        Appends (or sets) a value to a certain string property in a copy of this style data object. If the value to append contains the given separator character it's distinct parts will be appended separately and only if they do not already occur in the current value.
        Parameters:
        rName - The name of the string property to append to
        sValue - The string to append
        sSeparator - The separator string between an existing value and the new one
        Returns:
        A copy of this instance with the given property changed

      • merge

        Returns:

      • set

        public <T> StyleData set(de.esoco.lib.property.PropertyName<T> rName,
                         T rValue)
        Returns a copy of this style data object with an implementation-specific style value set. The meaning of such styles depends on the actual user interface toolkit of the current EWT implementation. A style that is not known by a certain implementation will be ignored by it.

        To prevent different EWT implementations from confusing their styles the keys for a certain implementations should always start with an implementation-specific prefixes that are separated by dots, like 'Swing.LayoutKey'.

        Parameters:
        rName - The property name of the style
        rValue - The style value
        Returns:
        A copy of this instance with the given style set

      • setFlags

        public final StyleData setFlags(StyleFlag... rFlags)
        Returns a Copy of this style data object that has a certain style flag set. For compatibility with standard EWT this method exists in variants with different argument counts. This is because the argument type in EWT is a variable length array of StyleFlag objects instead of integers.

        To retain compatibility with EWT it is therefore recommended to use multiple arguments instead of using a single integer that is the logical combination of multiple integer flags (which would only work in microEWT).

        Parameters:
        rFlags - The style flag to set
        Returns:
        A new instance that as a copy of this one that contains the given flag
